But If it had romance, this anime could really have been a masterpiece, but god knows if there will be another season, and maybe if the producer will then put some romance on it. I'll be hoping for it.

A guy that can beat Gods with his bare hands. A girl who can talk to animals and gain whatever ability they have. Another girl that can make people, animals and objects do whatever she commands. And a bunny-girl whose hair can turn from blue to pink, is really fast and wields a lightning spear.
Now that's a pretty odd cast there, now isn't it? But all these characters are unique and each of them have their own reason of liking them. 
Mondaiji-Tachi ga Isekai kara kuru sou desu yo? Is probably one of my favorite anime and one of the best one I've watched sofar. I was disappointed to know that it only had 10 episodes. But I'm confident it'll have a second season. 


Three kids who have supernatural powers, who are bored of the regular world are sent to another world to rebuild a broken community. The plot itself is pretty simple and straightforward. But the events that do occur while the story progresses more than make up for it. 


The characters are very diverse. Ranging from loli vampires to God-destroying teenagers. That's what also makes the anime enjoyable. Each has their own unique trait, despite the others being background or supporting characters. Izayaoi, though, reminds me a lot of Kazuto Kirigaya/Kirito from Sword Art Online. 


Why?


Cool and often times fight without difficulty. Overpowered compared to others. Such a badass. But Izayaoi also reminds me of Izaya from Durarara! "Entertain me!" They both said. 


I was impressed on how the developers incorporated Japanese, Greek/Roman, Hindu and many other mythology into the story. Another result in the diversity of the anime, which is always a good thing. 


The battle scenes are epic. That's all I can say about that, other than Izayaoi being a total overpowered badass on the field. 


The art and animation are very well done. Bright and smooth, respectively. And there were no signs of animation/art value dropping at any part of the anime. And the voice acting was also quite good. 


The OP didn't get through me. But the ending was so cute and aforable that I couldn't possibly miss out on it (You'll find out why once you see) 


Comedy and Action. Plus, a little bit of fanservice by Black Rabbit. One of the best anime released in winter 2012-2013. Excellent art and animation. And the battle scenes are done wonderfully. I highly recommend this anime.

I first saw this series a year ago from the time I am writing this review. I read the title in English and the first thought that hit me was the main protagonist and his friends save loli-children from another world that appeared in his world and a loli-harem begins. That thought scared me off before I could read what it was actually about. After stumbling upon this on Crunchyroll a year later and actually reading the preview I decided to give this a try. And man was my first thought way off. Now after that little backstory let's get this review of "Mondaiji-tachi gaIsekai kara Kuru Sou Desu yo?" under way. (Also there might be some minor spoilers)


Story-8

The overall story is our protagonist Sakamaki Izayoi and two heroines Kasukabe Yuu and Kudou Asuka is transported to a world where basically everything is decided by games. Izayoi and the two heroines meets Kurousagi (Black Rabbit). 


*minor spoiler alert*


 Kurousagi tells them she summoned them, and why she summoned them, to the world of games called Little Garden, and explains to them the rules of this world and she also tells them they each have a unique "Gift". These "Gifts" are just superhuman powers and they can also be rare/powerful items. They agree to her reasons of why she summoned them here and join her in the world of games, and so the adventure beings. The series is broken into several arcs each one with a villain and a reason why they fight the villain, e.t.c, e.t.c. Not going to go into any more detail about that, it will take way too long. In the story there are some plot holes that are not mentioned, like "What happens in the world where Izayoi came from because he was teleported out of it." But there are no serious plot holes that stops you from enjoying the show. And for those that have not watched the series and is questioning the plot hole I just mentioned, you will understand why it is not a big issue if you watch the series. The arcs are very well done, each arc ending is tied with a pretty bow no loose ends come to mind while I am writing this review. If I did miss anything, I can't really do anything, so sorry. The one problem that comes to mind with the story is that it is way too short. For a 10-episode they packed a lot into it and leaves the ending for more. So I vote for a second season, even though it probably will not be happening anytime soon.


Art-9

When I judge art for animes, I divide it into two sections. The Art and The Animation. In "The Art" section I will review how well the characters are drawn, how well I think they are colored and how well drawn the background and scenery and stuff like that is drawn/looks. In "The Animation" section I will review how well the anime was animated, the CG and stuff, and the choreography for action scenes (if there are any). I am not going to assign values to each section but from the general art score you can probably guess what it will be. Moving on!


The Art: The characters are really well drawn. They look the same through scene shifts and close-ups, their eyes don't look out of proportion in any scene, they don't have disappearing noses *cough*cough* mahou sensou *cough*cough*. The scenery is incredible. It looks very realistic as in the drawing looks like the real thing but you can tell it's a drawing. I will be honest, I am not good at reviewing any sort of art. So yeah, I'm sorry, but I will try my best. The scenery stuff doesn't look like the art staff photoshopped a tree and animated in a thousand times to make a forest, the scenery does look hand drawn or at least drawn on those drawing programs you use tablets for. Whatever. I hope you get the point. Again, I am a terrible art reviewer and this review is also probably not that great, but whatever. Moving on!


The Animation: The animation for this series is great. The bright colors are animated well so they stand out more on screen. The animation for the scenery is incredible. If you want a good explanation of the animation, just go watch the series. I hope you'll know what I mean if you do. Next. The choreography for the action series is done fabulously. Nothing seems off or anything. The Cg was great except for the explosions. All the CG's looked great and above average to me, but the explosions seemed like the ones you see in DBZ. Not the best compared to the other CG's. If you want a better explanation, just go watch the series yourself.


Sound-7

The music in this, I found, was average. People may agree with me some may not. The OP was good. It is my favorite  song in this series because it is catchy, upbeat and has a somewhat nostalgic tune at one point. The ED is not my favorite. No offense to anybody but I did not like the singer's voice in the ED. Don't get me wrong, I am not saying it is bad I am just saying I did not like it. The tune in the ED was forgettable to me, and didn't appeal to my taste in music. Again, not trying to say it was bad. The only good part of the ED I found about it was the animation that went along with it. Some may agree some may disagree, but it always brought a smile to my face to see Kurousagi get pumped to get everybody dancing again. If you have no idea what I am talking about, watch the ED. The battle music and all other background music was good. I can't say much about these because they either went so well with the scenery I did not notice or they did not really stand out or anything that made the music memorable. Either way I can't rate this part very high because I can't really remember the background music.


Character-8

The characters, I believe, are the strongest and most weakest point of the series. Izayoi, Asuka and Yuu all break the main lead stereotypes. I will go into more detail individually later. And we have Kurousagi, the one main lead that doesn't break the stereotypes. Moving on to details.


Izayoi is not the common protagonist. Which makes him super awesome! He is not a whiny highschool boy that believes that friendship will triumph and all that sh*t. Izayoi is a badass with power to match. *Spoiler Alert* Izayoi is so powerful he can throw rocks so hard that on contact with another object, an explosion (if contact with water) or crater (if contact with another solid object) will appear. Don't get him wrong, he is not a complete jerk. He believes in teamwork and that, but only when it is required. He knows that strength of the individuals he is surrounded by and knows that they can handle themselves fine, if the individuals keep their calm. Izayoi has is usually always calm and looks for a way to relieve his boredom when not planning something. Izayoi also has an intelligence that can make even the smartest Asian jealous. Able to solve complex problems and puzzles himself when his teammates can't. The problem though is that he gets little to no backstory. His solutions to problems are usually very rash and there is no thinking process shown when he is solves complex puzzles. What they do show when he solves complex puzzles is him appearing out of nowhere saying he solved the puzzle and gives a very very brief explanation of what he did, which complicated things even more for me because I had to stop and try to think about it, but to no avail. Regardless of those problems, Izayoi is a great character.


Asuka is a female lead that is not absolutely useless! Thank god for that! Right now, I can focus on what she isn't  but I think it will be quicker to tell you what she is. Asuka is a girl heir to rich family and business. *Spoiler Alert* her "Gift" is that she can bend people's actions to what she says. She is seen in the series as a strong female lead that can fend for herself and gladly help and defend her friends when needed. She is confident in her power and is not afraid to use it. Her intelligence is not as great as Izayoi's but she is still incredibly smart. She helps pitch in ideas when needed, picks fights only  when she knows she can win, she is funny and you also get to see a little more of a childish side to her in the later parts of the series. After seeing terrible heroines in SAO, School Days, STB, Tokyo Ravens, e.t.c. She is a breath of fresh air that I really needed.


Yuu is a mysterious girl. She is relatively silent throughout the series. And isn't seen doing much. But what we do see is incredible. She has quite the way with animals, she can eat a ton and much more hidden talents. We do get some nice backstory on her and how she got her "Gift" but other than that there is nothing else. She is not useless, in fact she would rather take on some tasks by herself so that others won't get hurt. I can't say much else since there isn't much else to say. But she is a great character even if she doesn't do as much as the others.


Lastly we have my favorite Kurousagi.


Kurousagi is somewhat overprotective and very overreactive. She is voiced by one of my favorite voice actors: Iori Nomizu. (Don't judge we all have different opinions). Kurousagi is a moon rabbit of the Little Garden and also has the rank of an aristocrat within the Little Garden. She is a motherly figure to the other three main characters and to all her friends. She cares more about her friends than herself, *spoiler* even selling herself as a sex slave to regain one of her friends. But that just adds to her charm. Kurousagi is not the brightest thinker within the group, but makes up for it in flashy fanservice and attacks. I may be decribing her as useless but when she gets angry in the series, you don't want to mess with her, in fact she is probably the only one in the group that can fight Izayoi head on and have a chance of winning. We see what Kurousagi has been through before the other three main characters stepped into the Little Garden and what her dream is. Overall she is a loveable character because she gets flustered easlily when Izayoi or another character, Shiroyasha, teases her, she serves as great comic relief and I think she is the character with the most backstory within the series.


Overall, the characters are great, they are smart, strong and funny. But the series being only 10-episodes really cuts down on any character development and backstory. Which I think can be overlooked because A. You can only fit so much into 10-episodes and B. What we do see from the characters are great. We can see them using all their talents to help each other and they do not change who they are within the span of the series. 


Enjoyment-9

I personally really enjoyed this series. It got me back in the mood for watching anime after a month or so because it had an interesting premise and characters. Plus the look of the anime is amazing. The jokes are a little cliche but what is an anime without its cliches? 


Overall-9

For some final words outside of the review. Congrats on reading this far, I am sorry if I was beating around the bush at times, and if I did take up too much of your time. I honestly believed that my review was not going to be so long. So again, sorry for taking your time. This is my first review so that's why it is not that great. If you have some comments or hate, comment on my profile, feedback is appreciated. It makes me feel good that people have taken their time to read my opinions, and will help me improve my reviews if I do any more. Back to the review. This is definitely an enjoyable watch. I highly recommend it to any body that needs a lighthearted watch or needs something to get them back into anime. The characters are enjoyable, the art and animation are above average and the story leaves little room to question. The bad part is that this is only 10-episodes so there is not much character development or any room for backstory. The music is not so great either. And there are some plot holes that do pop up, but does not distract you from the overall stuff that goes on.

Given the number of cute girls, loli's, and a rabbit girl, you would expect a lot of perverted content, but this Anime is very tame and managed to keep their full clothing on 98% of the time. The story and journey are amazing, but 10 episodes are not even close to being enough to cover everything and given how much potential there was, there could have been so much more, easily 50+ eps worth. That is the only issue I found, which leads to a lot of content that never got a whole lot of depth and a story that seems somewhat rushed and unfinished,or possibly all the material in between that could have been done.


There is a very satisfying amount of action, it is what these games come down to, even though they could be kind of game. Aside from a brief, and another slightly longer hot springs scene, 1 image, and a couple pervert based jokes, there is none of that content surprisingly.  Something interesting is the inclusion of some mythology and fairy tail/history bits, so if you are into those, it makes the story quite a bit more appealing. If there is 1 positive thing to say about the rather short episode count, it's that it's never boring as something is always happening. It doesn't feel conclusive though, conclusive to 1 incident, yes, but for the Anime, no.


The characters are the key component here, and make it so enjoyable. They made the cast quite interesting, and there are several, all rather diverse. They did go pretty loli & female heavy, but given the action, their target audience is males, they keep their clothes on though, minus one scene. The costumes for the characters look great, and the coloring & design of the characters look good too. The special skills each character has is quite interesting, I didn't find anyone to be boring.


I liked the colorful animation and colorful design of the characters. The opening was pretty epic, but the ending rather lame.


Overall, a great watch, even if it doesn't feel conclusive or finished. The characters combined with the story make it really entertaining, and there is plenty of action. It never feels boring and unfortunately, the Anime is over before you know it. The cast is female heavy, and loli heavy too, but at least they don't use them to sell the Anime as perverted material beyond a few brief moments and stick to keeping it tasteful, they could have easily gone the other route and sold it for the "plot".

A couple of issues from the top:
* It doesn't contain the upskirt panty shots found in current anime like Senran Kagura.
* It's only 10 episodes long. It states that it's gonna have 3 more episodes...
With that being said; the people behind this ANIME (as oppose to "animu") went out of their way to correct that one eyesore that nearly EVERYONE within the Wapanese animu industry refuses to touch. And that's THE SHOUNEN LEAD.
Izayoi is as smart as he is overpowered. He takes no crap from females, even his fellow "problem children" he meets before they all become friends. But he's no bastard. You'll like himwhen you get to know him better.\n\n
I mean, sure. Izayoi's not the run-of-the-mill useless self-insert either either polluting the current, popular animu as of late or being 100% excluded from it. But he's not Rance.\n\n
More episodes of this show need to be made; only to prove that you don't have to ride the animu industry's bandwagon of ill-written garbage. Sure you won't make as much money as KyotoAnimu on down. It has been some time since I finished "Mondaiji-tachi" for the first time and since then it has become my most rewatched anime.
I will keep this review short but try my best to hightlight what is so good about it but also mention why it is not absolute 10 for me.
First point on my "why you SHOULD watch list" are the characters. If you like badass lead, who doesnt like messing around, is OP and has also really strong sidekicks this is for you. All of them has nicely written personalities, are somewhat unique and it can be considered a small miracle regarding they hadonly 10 episodes to present them.


Second point is the fun and enjoyment. This anime is really relaxing, funny and easy to watch. You can turn off your brain and watch nicely animated fights with no big stress that main charters will get their ass kicked, followed by decent fan service provided by local bunny girl.


Last point is the story. Although cliche as the anime can be, it has set on the other hand quite unique backstory and world which could be later delevoped in decent story (yes you can read the novel, but you know ... anime has moving pictures).

Yes, I say could. Here lies your main reson why "you SHOULD NOT" watch this anime. And its when you dont like unfinished stories, opened ending etc.. Im not quite sure why this has only 10 episodes it so much wasted potencial I would cry.


So there you have it, if you can overcome that its only 10 episodes long and although the one arc of the story is finished, main journey has only began just not in the anime, you will experience one of the most enjoyable OP main lead ever created in anime.

So Mondaiji is a story that follows 3 problem children from different places around the world. All of these kids have special powers that they are able to use. One day they receive a letter that comes out of no-where. They have no idea who sent the letter or how it got there, but the letter talks about needing their power, and this is where the story begins. 
After these events it follows how these children deal with the problems they face in the new world they were sent to, encountering many strange people/beings a long the way. It was a really enjoyable story, Iespecially liked the fact that all of the kids had very powerful abilities. Izayoi being the strongest one by far. You can't go wrong with a super powerful cocky main can you? :p


I did feel that they could have done a lot more with this than just the 10 episodes, but the ending seemed to have more to be told, so hopefully that might be a sign for a possible second season! Now on to my specific review points.


Story 8/10

Now this may not be the most original story-line, but it did have many redeeming factors. In this world they can have a better life where they use their powers and want to stay. Also, they play things called gift games, which is a pretty interesting thing. It only has 10 episodes and 1 ova, which was kind of disappointing, but the way it ended seemed open, so maybe a season 2? c:


Art 9/10

The art was really well done. There was a lot of detail in the background images, which made for a really nice looking anime overall. The characters looked awesome as well, and the battle scenes were pretty nicely done. I really don't have any complaints on the art.


Sound 8/10

The sound was pretty good, the battle scenes had some pretty nice effect sounds, which was nice to see. The voice actors seemed to match very well to each of the characters.


Character 7/10

They did not go into the past of each main all that much. They described their situation to some extent during the time-frame right before they left their world, but they didn't go into their pasts or how they got their powers. Other than the fact they didn't give much back-story on any of the characters, I believe all the mains were all pretty likable.


Enjoyment 9/10

This anime for me was pretty much everything I love. A new world, Super Powerful Mains, different types of beings, and action! It was cool to see how they went on dealing with all of the conflicts in this new world. Also, I really loved the action scenes with Izayoi, he is just too badass. 


Overall 8/10

If you are a fan of action this is definitely a must watch. It has a pretty cool story behind it as well. I wish they would have added more episodes, but it was still a great anime. I'm just hoping for a season 2. Non-the-less, this is one of my favorite anime, if you like action and powerful main characters, this a great anime for you!

I guess on the realistic side the director Yasutaka Yamamoto was pretty much aware that they can only rely on the fantasy and action genre so much that it's not worth extending it up to 12 or 13 episodes, bueno, Aquí están mis posiciones para este anime:




Story-Fair 6.


The story was too simple and did rely on some dark children's fairly tale, but the plot depended heavily on the 3 brats who were bored and were itching for some excitement  in which they got.



 Art-Fair 6. 


It is not bad, but not that good either since I was hoping to see what color panty was Kurousagi wearing.



 Sound-Fair 6. 



Well I did like Kurouasgi's cutsy voice and Izayoi tough guy tone,but the turn off was the ending theme. 


Characters-Fair 6



 I really like the fact that the main protagonist did sided with the weaker group, but Kurousagi's role was for me was a double standard, though she did summon the 3 brats to  aide the "No Names" her role seem to conflict the side where she belongs, if she is somewhat of a moderator then she should be a neutral entity and have no connection of whatsoever with the 'No Names," therefore she should have punish Galdo Gasper for causing chaos in episode 2, also she should have also have the authority to regulate the Gift Game that occurs between the protagonist and the antagonist in this anime, frankly her role was pretty much chaotic, which she claims to be with the "No Names" and yet she doesn't make any effort to protect her own side, in fact she even lacks leadership skills.

Please do not offend me when I write this review:
The title should be called "Convenient children are coming from another convenient world". This plot is full of convenience and there is no tension.
The art was fantastic and the sound was good. I gave it equally a 6. However, I find that the main character Izayoi was too overpowered and the rest of the cast are like useless and they do not have the chance to be powerful. The main character Izayoi always gets the job done.
What I want to see in an action anime is everyone have equal strength and their depth of power. Eg.Yozakura Quartet, Shakugan no Shana. To me, characters who are too perfect are too painful to watch because there will be no character development like Sword Art Online, Kaze no Stigma.  


Even worse is Izayoi's arrogance which really enrages me. I dropped this anime because I find it too predictable that he will save the day in the end and not to mention his attitude. I won't bother watching it again. Even some cases like Kirito from SAO, Kazuma & Ayano from Kaze no Stigma.


To me, every hero is unique in so many ways. Nobody is perfect.


There is actually no character development at all and I will not watch another season of this anime. Even if other characters besides Izayoi save the day, I do not feel any tension in this anime.


I really dislike it if they always pull KuroUsagi's ears all the time. It bugs me so much. If you like this show, good for you. This is my opinion so please respect me. Thank you very much.

"Mondaiji defines a new standard for wish fulfillment" is my first thought after watching this anime.
In fact, it is a haphazard mixture of cliched trademark elements of modern anime that draws so much criticism and at the same time are basically "what sells". To elaborate, perhaps the most well-known/notorious anime where this formula was taken, perfected, and executed is Sword Art Online. 
Now let's talk about Mondaiji, while keeping that in mind. Overpowered main character. Check. Bright fantasy world. Check. Loli. Check. Moe. Check. Tsundere. Check. Sexy bunny girl. Check. Cute pet. Check. Bishounen. Check.
And yet at this juncture I must remind everyone that manyof the best things in this world are, in fact, made out of the most common/cliched ingredients. The beauty lies in how each part is assembled to create something wonderful. Indeed, in Mondaiji I see a (near) perfect example of this. At no place was I not amused and entertained by the witty back-and-forth between the main characters and the occasional fan-service. The fantasy world is well-constructed and so blatant in its over-the-top-ness that I would think, "Well, we're talking about Little Garden after all. Anything is possible I guess", whenever seeing something extraordinary. The characters by themselves are nothing too spectacular; in fact, you could probably name for each of them any number of similar characters in other anime. And yet they fit perfectly into the story and I never got tired of, or annoyed by them. Of course I must not forget to mention the main male protagonist, Izayoi Sakamaki, who manages to be bad-ass, clever, perverted, funny, and chill all at the same time.\n\n
If you are looking for a great adventure, look no further. This short 10 episodes well take you on a journey you will never regret. Yet if you are looking for something dark, meaningful, romantic, depressing(I can never understand why people like to watch shows which end up in nothing but a bucket of tears), erm you are probably at the wrong place.\n\n
Some food for thought inspired by Mondaiji(and other well-known shows, ahem Superman): If ever you had abilities/talent that put you above everyone else, what would you do? Would you try to 'save the world'? Would you pretend like you never had powers and live out a normal life? Will you journey around the world and end up bored because you have seen everything there is to see? Hm..\n

"I can't believe this."
Problem Children is one of those back pocket anime's. All of the factors that make a fantastic show have come together, the stars and planets have aligned perfectly, and in their wake, my favorite anime of all time was contrived. This show is poles apart from other anime of it's time. I legitimately tried to find one thing i disliked about this show, and i came up with nothing. Problem Children is literally  absolutely ideal.
The show is basically about a group of literally bad-ass kids that are summoned to a new world, where games reign supreme. The games in this showare so well thought out, that i can not even compare it to No Game No Life. The games and lead characters are much more developed then say, Sora or Shiro, who are left completely bland in a world with so much potential. With a strong supporting cast featuring Jack O Lantern, Mikenoko the cat, and DEEEEAAAANNN, enjoyers of No Game No Life will find this show to be far superior in every way possible. 


Story: 10.5/10


The story, oh boy where do i begin. The plot in Problem Children is completely fleshed out, leaving nothing to be desired by the viewer. The flow is seamless, there is never a part of the plot that moves too quickly, and all of the fabulous twists and turns stay true to the plot and the world. The three main characters, You, Izayoi, and Asuka are summoned to a new world by a mysterious and attractive girl named Black Bunny. Upon arrival, they must band together in various ways to form a community that can stand on its own two feet. 


Games 12/10


The game aspect is where this show truly shines, although please bear in mind that all aspects shine, i just had to pick one point to "rule them all" (lol). The games range from card games with intense strategic decisions, to battles against literal gods, to griffon races with more then just their lives on the line, their pride will also be on the line! I don't want to spoil any of the games from this anime, but trust me, this is some of the best gaming related anime content available on the web. 


Art 11/10


Ok, I have a good story to tell for this one. First off, the art is out of this world (literally, they are in a different world). The characters and designs are astounding, and characters such as Mikenoko, Dean, and Black Bunny will have designs, graphics, and effects that you have never seen before. So i have this friend who is a pretty good artists, and i told her to draw some of these Problem Children characters for fan-art.  Long story short, the art in this anime was on such a high level, that my artist friend didn't even have the skill level required to drawn them! That is just crazy and mind blowing because she draws pretty good Dragonball Z and Bleach, and Naruto. 


Sound 10/10


The music, good god the music is bliss to my ears. I have an ipod soundtrack dedicated to all the songs from this anime. I convinced my bowling league to play these songs on repeat for league nights, and the other bowlers love it. It works great to play games to this gaming anime sound track. Basically, any game lover will love to play games to these music tracks. I know i sure do! 


The voices are another part that just adds to this anime greatness. Black Bunny, along with the entire cast have fantastic voice overs. I would put these voice overs on par or better then Dog Days. (which is fan-effing-tastic)


Character 11.2/10


at least 7 of my top 10 favorite characters come from this anime. The characters are brilliant, and developed so well you might actually think some are really real. the conversations and humor work so well together, that this is the best and most funniest made show possible.


Enjoyment 88/10


If you couldnt tell allready, this show is EM-EH-ZING. The 4 hours that this show brought to me were possibly the best four hours of my life, not counting my trip to Florida last year. I would say any one that rated No Game No Life a 3 or higher will probably give this show a 10. 


Overall 10/10


A perfect anime. Many say that such a thing is impossible to create, but this anime has gone and proooved everyone wrong. the fact tat only 50k people have watched this is a shame to us all. This anime should be regarded as THE anime to watch, and the anime to bring new viewers in, like death note or Dragon Ball Z are now. Ive shown this show to 12 other people, and everyone of them agrees that this is amaizng. Words are not good enough to describe this show, so the only thing left to do is to get off your butt, sit down, and watch this anime

I'll start off my review by saying that Mondaiji-tachi ga Isekai kara Kuru Sou Desu yo? is a nice power fantasy anime. I know there is a light novel series out there with the same title, which the anime is based, but I have never read it and will base my review on the show itself entirely.
Story: The story starts off with three teenagers from different parallell worlds, in different time lines, with each their own special, superhuman ability. They all get the same letter, inviting and summoning them to the lands of Little Garden, a land between worlds where people survive through Gift Games,a kind of challenge with rewards decided upon beforehand. The land of Little Garden is inhabited by all kinds of species which ranges between creatures such as animals, animal-human hybrids, angels, demons, monsters, gods, humans etc. The three teenagers (Izayoi, Yoh and Asuka) are recruited into a community (a kind of small group/nation) to help restore it. The story isn't complicated and it doesn't need to be. It contain exiting power fantasy battles, some scheming and riddles, and problem solving. The characters all have their own unique personality that kind of fits their special ability, like how Asuka (a priviliged high born lady) has the ability to force her commands on other people or objects, but could use a little more back story. The weakness of the plot is how short the series is, with only 10 episodes and 1 OVA episode, which doesn't give enough time to properly explain the setting and the characters. From what I've read the light novel series it's based on should contain enough story for well more than 30 episodes. Still, it's an enjoyable and simple series.\n
Art & Sound: The art in this show is astounding, with great detail to the environments as well as the characters, adding vibrant colors and dark hues when needed. The character designs are all nice to watch and the movements of the the characters and the landscapes (water, clouds, etc.) are all well done. The sound and voice acting is quite superb, but has some drops in quality from time to time (especially when a character is howling or roaring).\n
Overall: I thoroughly enjoyed this show, reveling in the action and comedy, but wish there was more. Unfortunately it doesn't seem like there will be adapted any more, with nothing added since I first saw it several years ago. Still, I think many people can find a lot of enjoyment in what little part of it we were given.\n
Enjoy!

I wound up here from the 'supernatural' genre tag, and I wasn't disappointed.

The Dub voice choices were good, some of my favourites which makes it even better.
The beginning gives you a good story, throws you in straight away, though in a good way, so it's enjoyable. 
The plot is different, yet interesting. The mixing of genres is done really well and each one is covered nicely.
Though it's cliche, the main characters are over powered. They're dealing with adult problems but there's immaturity mixed in which makes it flow. 
If you're a fan of pervertedcharacters, you'll like Izayoi. His character is done really well, but so are the others. The characters are a big part of an anime and these ones are good. They're individuals, you can tell their different personalities with very minimal background information, and there's a character for the different sorts people enjoy. Egotistical pervert? Yep. Big boobs? Of course. Loli? You bet. \n\n
I thought it would lead to a different ending, but it was still good and a fitting ending. It's definitely worth watching. \n
Here's hoping it gets a sequel!

Problem Children From Another World Are Coming, Aren't They? is an enjoyable anime that's surprisingly short, despite it's long title. Speaking of, I really do have to gripe about these ridiculous titles that Japanese conceive. Seriously, why are all of their recent titles so freaking long? These aren't even titles anymore, they're entire sentences!
Story: The story itself starts off kind of cliched. Children from another world are basically summoned by a chick with bunny ears to participate in what's known as Gift Games within a world called Little Garden. While the premise is pretty stereotypical, I like how they were actually summoned for a reason- even if helping a community that's barely keeping itself together is, in itself, a cliche. While I've seen this done plenty of times, I will admit that I have seen pretty much everything there is to see out of the entertainment industry, so watching a story get re-ashed in this manner doesn't really bother me all that much.


Characters: The characters themselves are interesting, but some of them are kind of bland at the same time. It's hard to explain. I genuinely like the characters in it, but I can see the archetypes they're made from. Izayoi is your typical bad boy who's gotten bored with life and wants to have fun, Asuka is a rich girl who's gotten bored with life and wants to free, You (Yes, that is her name) is a lonely girl who's gotten bored with her life and wants to make friends, and Black Rabbit is your typical fanservice girl complete with big breasts and bunny ears. These aren't really "deep" characters, when you think about it. In fact, they seem fairly one-dimensional at times. However, I think there's charm in the simplicity of these characters. While none of them will win any "Character of the Year" awards, I enjoyed watching the chaos they caused and laughed during some of the scenes.


Sound: While this isn't something that I'm big on, I can say that the sound quality was nice. There wasn't anything overtly wrong with it, and both the subbed and dubbed version had some decent voice acting. I actually liked some of the dubbed actors better than the subbed ones in this. I don't know the name of the guy who played Izayoi, but he really is a good VO. While some people sound like they're just reading lines from a script, his voice actually has emotion in it, which is important in voice acting and something that a lot of anime voice actors seem to fail at.


Art: The artwork here is nice, but uninspired. Having only been created within the last five years or so, this is a relatively new anime, and it generally follows an art style that is similar to most other new anime out there. The characters are vibrant and colorful, the backgrounds are well-drawn and contrast nicely with the characters, and the designs are fairly nice. However, while the artwork isn't bad, there is nothing here that makes it stand out from the other anime I've seen.


Animations: While the animation is smooth and fluid, there is only so much "I'm so cool look at how my air rustles in the wind" that I can stand. One thing this anime has a lot of is Hair Rustling. You've probably seen this before, even if you haven't heard of it. This is when a strong wind kicks up around the main character, whose hair suddenly waves about fiercely while Mr. or Ms. MC smirks a smug little smirk. There is a lot of that here, and it got kind of annoying at times. Despite my complaint, the animation is still nice and all of the characters were on model during the action sequences, which is more than I can say for some anime.


On a whole, I think this anime was interesting. If they ever came up with a second season, then I would probably watch it. I may even watch season 1 again if the mood takes me. However, while I enjoyed the anime personally, I can also unequivocally state that this anime is not without its flaws.

Whatever, I just like to reminisce over my past life and thin of the times that I don't want to neck myself with a noose. (Editor's note : More suicide jokes! What an edgy guy!)
TL;DR = As a person who's living in the 2017 and realizes this is a 2013 anime, I feel this anime is one of the best Isekai anime. Very good art for 2014, Sound was crafted well and captures the essence of the scenes, story was forgettable but last bit was fun. And I thoroughly enjoyed it. And... Season 2 when?
Mondaiji-tachi ga  ISEKAIkara kuru sou desu yo... is a mouthful of a title so lets shorten that into Mondaiji instead. Mondaiji is probably one of the founding fathers of the Isekai genre in the world of Anime but we all know who the real founding father is... (sword art online) But I digress. This anime spawns from the wave of demands of the Isekai genre after Sword Art Online finished airing (or turns to crap). 


Anyways on to my review:


===Story===

Progression : 9

Storytelling : 7

Story uniqueness : 5


If SAO has a memorable but bad story progression. This anime suffers from good story but it is easily forgettable. I mean I still remember everything though because I have a good memory of everything except for School and Studies (apparently).  A gary stu is brought into another world because of his powers, because he is a gary stu, he tries to fight against the "evil" by abusing his powers. Sounds familiar? (No game No Life, Sword Art Online, and basically nearly all isekai genre) Oh man... I thought we're done with this. But what makes the story memorable though however is the uniqueness of the things that is happening in the anime. Such as the final arc of the anime. To be honest story is not the strongest suit of this anime so lets skip to the art section because there's not much for me to talk about here aside from it being the typical isekai anime.


===Art===

Artstyle : 8

Animation: 9


Ahhh Diomedea, the studio that creates mediocre anime because of their mediocre stories. But to tell the truth, the animation and artstyle is really good for a 2013 anime. And then... there's the 2017 Sho-bitch...... but that's for another time.

Judging the anime studio aside, yeah, the animation is really good, fight scenes were coherent and everything is animated beautifully. I just need to wait a thousand years more to get the season 2 of this anime to get animated so I can see more of Izayoi's bullshit powers in action.


===Sound===

Music : 8

Voice Acting : 7/8

Sound FX : 7


Sound effects are... somewhat ok... but I don't like it. Somebody may appreciate the sound effects but I think its just ok. Not good but ok.

Music is interesting. at least for the music within the anime itself. Opening doesnt really fit the theme of the anime. At least that's how I view this. But... ED... Always has a spot in my heart.


===Character===

Overall : 7


To be honest, the characters are all bland, lets talk about them one by one. To be honest the only ones that stands out is Izayoi, KuroUsagi, and Shiro Yasha for good reasons.


Izayoi : Gary Stu in an Isekai world. Look at : Kirito, Sora, or any oher kind of OP isekai Protag


KuroUsagi : Probably main "Love" (quote intentional for good reasons). It's basically a precursor of Aqua. A literal Clown of a guide.


And then I forgot the 2 of the main characters because their backstory is bland and uninteresting. Really poor character development for the 2 especially for the one with the Cat. Since the other girl does have some character development in the last arc of the series which is the last battle of the season.


But Shiro Yasha is quite memorable since she is quite unique in terms of character. Which I wont spoil here. But let me just say that she is one of my favorite characters and probably the only character that I find interesting.


Antagonists wise, I find them actually way better than I expected. They're definitely well more defined than its direct competitor No Game No Life since the Antagonist there is kinda... tasteless.


===Enjoyment===

Overall : 9


Surprisingly I enjoyed this anime though. Since because back then Isekai genre was actually relatively new and the animations are charming. For sure this is probably one of my favorite Isekai anime since the world of the game is well relatively good. Is this better than SAO? well I can't compared it since its not apple to apple, but I definitely enjoyed this more than SAO. But is this better than No Game No Life? the answer to that is No. No Game No Life somehow creates a something of an, definitely better than Mondaiji since they tackled : Character development and more defined characters and they have better characters... At least for the protagonists.


===Genre Specials!===

Isekai : 9

Comedy : 7

Harem : 10

Fan-Service : N/A


I must say that the genre specials here is pretty much good, all I can say that they nailed the genre specifics. The only gripe I have with this anime is that the comedy is basically always a jab. Sometimes it works otherwise it just leaves a pain in my mouth from cringing from the jabs. Fan Services does not applicable here except if you watch the OVA which is not applicable in this instance since I don't want to touch OVAs at all.


===Overall===

Total Score : 8


Mondaiji is a really good anime if you want some cheap laughs from Kuro Usagi's stupid decisions (Aqua of this anime) and if you want some cheap action sequences that you like to see. And basically this anime is the must watch for the most OP character in the anime history. As an avid reader of the Light novel, I would not recommend for those who already read the light novel because it is way better in terms of story. But I can say that this is a safe anime to pick up if you want some fun and action at the same time while not sacrificing too much time watching the 1 season (10 episodes). I enjoyed it, so most of you should too because its not cringy and there's no moe bait trash.


Also Season 2 when?

Problem Children focused on three superpowered teens from different time periods who get whisked away to a parallel world where they have to assist a struggling land with reclaiming its status by competing in competitions against demon lords. For a 10-episode TV anime, this series does offer enough to engage its audience as the games that our leads have to contend with have a bit of variety to them outside of fighting such as one challenge where one of the leads have to ride a griffin and having to put some effort at thinking things out, as the series usually dabbles into elements of legendaryand mythical lore when our leads accept challenges in games. The teens in this series appear to be rather intelligent and competent when it comes to the use of their abilities, and several of the leads get enough fleshing out of their backgrounds and some character growth where you could care for them (including Black Rabbit). There is also a decent level of world building in the series to explore how the competitions in the series effect differing kingdoms and show the amount of risk that they have for the alternate world's residents and status.


The series does have its issues. The title's male lead Izayoi is rather underdeveloped compared to the other leads and doesn't go through the difficulties and developments that the girls underwent, making his character a bit shallow. The series also usually tosses in moments of fan service that are a waste of time, including its bonus OVA episode, and has an open ending as things with the No Names are still unresolved.


Visually, the series sports gorgeous scenic shots of the parallel world in the series and decent-looking character designs with vivid color and a good amount of visual detail, though designs are a bit on the conventional side. Animation is modest with basic movements yet resorts to shortcuts during any action scenes to simulate fluid movement, especially in sequences that involve intense action such as Izayoi's use of his powers in action. The music does its part to complement key scenes with a mix of upbeat and comical insert tracks and use of J-pop songs, though nothing in particular greatly stuck out with the series for me with the music.


Gripes aside though, Problem Children is still a decent time-killer with characters that break the mold for a fantasy-adventure title and having some unique elements to the games that they have to confront. It's worth a look if you want a break from more conventional fare.

This show is bad. That being said, it's enjoyable.
This review has minor spoilers
The show is effectively No Game No Life, but with worse animation, less interesting "games", and more punching
The thing is, No Game No Life had creative games that were twists on real games. The Gift Games always end up with people fighting, and very little else. There's a card thing at the start to prove how incredibly smart Izayoi is, but other than that there is no real puzzle, or Izayoi figures it out instantly with no evidence, pulling from a seemingly limitless pull of random knowledge that we don't know how hehas. Apparently there's background on him in the manga, but I'm reviewing the anime, so the manga doesn't matter


I'm mentioning Izayoi a lot, and that's because he's the main issue I have with the show. 


He's incredibly smart, not in a way that makes you think someone real could figure it out if they were smart enough, it's just like the knowledge was beamed into his head.


He will never lose a fight in the show, I can tell you that. Every fight but the last one he's in is a complete stomp. It's pretty much one punch man, but without the humor and hyping up someone only for them to be killed in one punch. 


Let's be honest, he's a textbook self insert character. He's an incredibly powerful(not for anything he did, just magically strong) perverted teenage guy who wants to enjoy himself in a fantasy world. That's pretty much the show's demographic. I can tolerate overpowered characters if they are played off as a joke(Saitama from One Punch Man), have some physiological or emotional conflict going on(Nanami from Katanagatari), or are against equally powerful characters(Alucard from Hellsing) 


Izayoi is none of those. He's just a teenager who wants to perv on girls and have fun...and is somehow more powerful than anyone else


The best thing about the show is the character interactions. Because, regardless of all that complaining I just did about how boring he is, I did enjoy the show. I enjoyed the characters having various spats, Izayoi and Shiroyasha bonding over trying to make Black Rabbit's outfit lewder, Yo and Asuka's slightly awkward friendship, and Jin trying to be more adult.


The fight were okay, entertaining in an over the top way, but just go watch Sengoku Basara for that. 


The animation was average, pretty good at times, painfully bad and low res at others. 


The overall story was extremely dull, had no real logic, and had nothing going on for it.


Some of the music was good, it definitely had a few hype moments.


In general, the show is okay. It's nothing great, it's nothing deep, it's nothing breathtaking. But it is fun, it does have enjoyable character interactions, and it does have a bunch of overpowered assholes screwing with the balance of power.

This is a great anime, everything is Very Well done, the Story, the Art, and the Characters, bringing Enjoyment into the scene.
The story is about three kids (teenagers) whom have supernatural powers, they are brought to a different world where Games (known as Gift Games) can be hosted or participated in.
The art style is nicely done in this Anime, I love the effect of the colours and the nice art style, it really dragged me in as well as others.
Characters are very nicely portrayed, I don't believe there was any character that I disliked to say the least, as well as that, the creators havemade sure that there is more than one character doing something, which is good, unlike some other anime I have seen where the one main character does all the fighting.


Overall, the anime was very satisfying to watch and I would recommend it for anyone else interested in anime.


Thanks,

- Anthony.

This has to be one of the shortest anime series that I have watched, but I must admit it was also one of the most enjoyable anime series to watch, the reasons being the story line, Art Work, Sound, Character development, & Enjoyment.
Story
The story line is very simple and easy to understand and isn't very complex either. Transporting unique individuals and transporting them to another world is a great idea but it has been done before and isn't anything new but I think in this particular anime series it complements the story line really well. I am scoring the story line a solid 9/10.
Art
The artwork done on each and every character was done really well, so I have no complaints whatsoever on the art work. Scoring it a solid 9/10.\n\n
Sound\n
The Opening theme and closing theme is one aspect that I liked also the background music and battle music is well balanced in the series. Character voices can be clearly heard so for this reason I am scoring it a solid 9/10. \n\n
Character\n
This series has some of the most interesting characters I have seen in an anime series. The main characters is very unique and interesting in there own way. Even minor characters are well balanced and interesting. Watching episode after episode the viewer gets to learn a bit more about each character as well as what role they fill in the group. Also the one MC is insanely overpowered which is fun to watch. So I am scoring a 9/10.\n\n
Enjoyment\n
Each episode was a joy to watch even if there aren't any actions scenes happening it still keeps the viewer entertained through out until the end. Some of the battle scenes is really short and doesn't get dragged out but that is a plus considering the series is only 10 episodes long, but there a a couple of fights that was really well done and fun to watch. So I am scoring a 9/10.  \n\n
Overall\n
If you the viewer is looking for a fun action short anime series I would recommend this show to everyone. Everything about this series makes for a great anime. I am just really sad that so far there isn't any word if a season 2 will be released. As mentioned before I would recommend this series to all anime fans out there so I am scoring a great 9/10.

To be honest not sure if this deserves a 10, but I'm giving it one anyways because like Air Gear, Kaze no Stigma, and SAO the main character is both strong and smart....which is shockingly rare and worth trying to push to the top. Onto the review:
Overall 10/10-
While not finished yet the story and setting is a perfect example of world building. You throw charters that we can relate to into an unfamiliar setting and then as they learn about the world so do we. It also skips the ramp up that plagues most action anime as well as having to have the MC beatento death each time before he can beat the next guy.\n\n
This world is truly interesting and the challenges (games) adds a very nice twist, with them we have constant access to different types of battles that can't always be solved through straight force. This is good because the MC is so over-powered that if all he needed to do was beat someone this would get quite boring. The restriction added in give a great challenge to the cast without needing them to be stupid or oblivious to their own powers as you typically see in other shows. I think this aspect of the story is what I like so much, the characters always need to be on top performance because the challenge can restrict them, therefore they don't have to act like idiots to make things a challenge for them.

I went into this anime without knowing anything, so I didn't know what to expect when I started it.
I thought that the story was interesting. The world that you are introduced to in the first episode was an interesting concept and I thought the story about how the characters came to be there was quite intriguing. However, I feel like there was a lack of explanation and development on the story.
The animation was quite pleasing to the eye. In some of the fight scenes, particularly scenes involving Izayoi, there is some cool animated effects, however nothing breathtaking.
I thought the OP was okay. I liked howit started very mellow and then transitioned to a quite intense rhythm, but it wasn't amazing. The END was cute, and I enjoyed it a bit better than the OP.\n
Out of the three main characters, only two got a brief back story in the anime, and the one that didn't was the one I was most interested in finding more about. I wish there was more development with the characters relationships with each other, and more development with the characters themselves.\n\n
In my opinion the anime had quite a slow start, however from time to time I would become intrigued by something mentioned or a new development in the story/with a character which would motivate me to keep watching. Although there were moments which I really enjoyed, there were quite a few parts where I zoned out and wasn't engaged.\n\n
Overall, there are many aspects of this anime which I enjoyed, however I did feel myself losing interest whilst watching it and needed to consciously force myself to pay attention.\n\n
Final Verdict: Average

"Problem Children Are Coming From Another World Aren't They?" is a fitting title for this anime. Long, drawn out, and hard to look at. I first stumbled upon "Problem Children" after being told it was similar to "No Game No Life," which I thoroughly enjoyed. Unfortunately, where "No Game No Life" shines, "Problem Children" comes up short.
Story - 5
The story begins when three kids, You, Asuka, and Izayoi are brought into a new world in a different dimension and different timeline because of their talents in their own worlds. Using their own unique talents, they set out to help Black Bunny rebuild her community. Thefirst few episodes are actually not bad, and we see these talents cleverly utilized in different game sequences that includes a game of "pick the face card," and a game of punchies against a god. However, it only goes downhill from there. The entire original plot ends up being forsaken as a new enemy comes in to wreak havoc on Black Bunny's world, or something like that. The change in plot happens so suddenly that you just can't seem to care much about what's going on anymore, and just want to see more games which become in-existent. 


Art - 7

The art quality is nothing special, but definitely nothing to slouch at. Black Bunny's world contains a wide variety of beautiful backgrounds and interesting landscapes that are a pleasure to look at. The main drawback is that the action sequences towards the end could have been animated better and are hard to follow.


Characters - 4

The real low point of "Problem Children" is the static characters. None of the main characters have any kind of interesting back story, and just come along on this mission because they have nothing better to do. The male lead, Izayoi is probably the worst of them all, as his talents and powers are never explained despite him being the "main" character and the strongest of the group. There really is no reason to root for the main characters in this show unfortunately, and I just couldn't care what happened to them.


Enjoyment - 6

The first half was somewhat enjoyable and had some good comedy, but the second half skips out on the comedy and instead focuses on action scenes that to be honest aren't very good. 


Overall - 6

Overall, "Problem Children Are Coming From Another World, Aren't they?" isn't necessarily a bad anime, but is in no means a good one either. Forgettable characters, uninteresting plot, and an unexciting second half leaves "Problem Children" with something to be desired. If you really enjoyed anime such as "No Game No Life" then "Problem Children" might be worth checking out, but don't expect it to be as entertaining as the former.

Why should you watch this series? Because it is FUN!

The series (Mondaiji for short) starts with 3 teens with unique abilities summoned to an usual world. They are to  play games and earn awards to surive. They will join 共同体 or union/community and grow with their friends together.
-- In short, life will be about playing games!
   And that is when the fun starts. 
There are more about the Mondaiji world:

     She possesses a seductive body but the heart of a pure shoujo. She is easy to tease.- One man lead and 3 main female casts and many other supporting female character

I finally review an anime from this year! (yay!) Mondaiji-tachi ga Isekai kara Kuru Sou Desu yo? is a delightful little anime about 3 powerful children that end up in a world that is run around the idea of risk and reward games, and where everything is for the sake of the player's enjoyment. But is it for the enjoyment of the viewers as well?
The thing that was most appealing about this anime was the concept of the world this anime takes place in, Little Garden. It has it's own unique set of rules and laws (and when I use this term I refer tothe rules of it's own universe) that it follows pretty closely without slipping on details for the sake of plot development. There were also some moments in this anime that honestly made me laugh and go "awwww!" like a school girl (masculine thoughts Gavin, masculine thoughts). However this is where the uniqueness ends, as everything in this anime slowly turns into Anime stereotypes, and usually not the good kind either


First problem, the characters were very bland, giving me the feeling that I've seen in before but done better. The main problems stemming from the male lead character. It is clearly his job to do all the fighting, but he does so with such unsatisfiying style. Pretty much every fight he ends up in is over in one punch. He never seems to ever come close to losing, so he never had a chance to grow or get better! I picked up this anime because I was told this character would be like Kirito from Sword Art Online (a really great anime btw), but at least HE was able to lose and better himself from it! 


Finally, this anime jumps all over Anime character stereotypes to the point where I feel it kinda makes fun of me. There are Tsundere characters (cold on the outside, sweet on the inside) that slowly appear. There are characters who are wearing as little clothes as possible for the sexual appeal. There are literally 3 loli characters (little sister type characters). It even goes as far as animal people, ANIMAL PEOPLE!! And to top it all off, a mediocre mech battle..... come on, really?


With an ending that doesn't really conclude anything, and doesn't leave me wanting more. I give Mondaiji-tachi ga Isekai kara Kuru Sou Desu yo? a 5/10. Good to watch if your looking for a short and sweet anime to put in between long ones, but on its own it's pretty meh. And god is it hard to type out it's freaking name!

First noticeable flaws:

4)This was probably intended for a younger audience than I first anticipated.  
Yeah the izayoi or whatever is strong and "cool" but there is no real depth to the guy and the show doesn't really give me a reason to really like this guy at all.  As I can tell he's the "selling point" of this series and because I didn't think that he was cool or a good character, the series just came crumbling down.  Also, yes Kurousagi is cute buta cute girl doesn't save a show from being terrible.  \n\n
The world building is also terrible.  They don't explain stuff well enough that I understand what's going on.  The story has a fan-fiction like over the top plot points and cliches.  \n\n
When I first started writing this, I thought I would give this show a 5 but then as I thought more about it, I think this show isn't a 5 but a 4 or a 3.

Hakoniwa which became the setting of this anime are somewhat unique, but unfortunately, he was not prepared sufficiently mature. In other words, the signs of a good structure can already be seen, such as competition between Community in fighting the big names and the seven gates that set of power among them. However, at the same time there are still many other things that are so vague in Hakoniwa, such as a hierarchical system that is in them, who included Maou, or how exactly the position Floor Master. Whether anime is trying to make his world is too complicated or is he just has notdared to give him a clear form, Hakoniwa still feels very chaotic. Similar problems also exist on the part of the story. Despite having a fairly simple plot - beat Maou to restore the glory of the No-Name - the framework of the story is immediately apparent, namely through a series of gift Games. Like a stage-the stage in a video game, looking forward to what and how the game is going to go through the characters always fun. However, the fun is just up there - looking forward, because it turns out games in this anime is not varied enough. In the end, everything is just going to be just a power struggle, and the main character is able to withstand any attack and penetrate any defense, even tense moments has never appeared. In conclusion, this anime show a lot of potential, but for this series, the potential still feels wasted.

Well for my second review I felt like writing about something I didn't like as much, Mondaiji-tachi ga Isekai kara Kuru Sou Desu yo? First, I want to start off by saying this. I watched this show because It was recommended here as something to watch if you liked No Game No Life. There is an inherent problem with recommendations. Often, they are made because shows  share a similar premise. NGNL and Mondaiji-tachi ga Isekai kara Kuru Sou Desu yo? (That is a kind of long title) are set in similar worlds, but their spirit is way different.  I will try to keepmy opinion of this show separate  from NGNL but a lot of my criticisms of the show stem off the comparisons I made. 

Story(4/10) 

While I like some things about this show it has a problem of anime adapted from light novels. That is it is slowly paced. There's nothing wrong with having a slow story, but I think in this case it hampers the story. Another problem with the show is the premise. The game system the world runs on just makes no sense. Why? I don't see any rules other than inside the game and if there are any rules they are not followed at all. We see the villains kidnap and kill captives(including children), spread diseases, steal, and commit acts of genocide. The story doesn't do much to explain why lawless villains need  to compete in such trivial games. It could be because the protagonists are so powerful that they wouldn't stand a chance in a normal fight, but most "games" they participate come down to a physical battle anyways. Talking about battles brings up another point about the series. How anti climatic the conflicts are in this series. The three protagonists have near limitless power to the point that only ever 2 of them have ever been rendered useless. The male protagonist beats an ocean god in the first episode with one blow to emphasize how ridiculous it is.  Does title mean anything in this show? To answer that, not really. Characters are given rank like demon lord, floor master, judge, God and they are all just as likely to be defeated or rendered useless. 

Sound (9/10) 

I can’t insult the sound. The OST is fairly nice and I like the ED. As for the VA’s they do their job well for being the characters they are. 

Art (9/10) 

I like the animation too. The show is enjoyable on that score.

Characters (3/10) 

This is where the show scores some bad points with me. First of all with the protagonist Izayoi, I don’t like him very much. Is he arrogant? The show likes to claim he is but he seems to have a plan for every eventuality. It’s not that he needs to though as he is the strongest character in the show. Is he dumb? Not really, the show really loves to emphasize his high intelligence. Is he weak? Defeating a water god with one blow gives you that answer. Okay, I give up does he have any flaws? He is kind of perverted but some anime fans consider that a feature. Izayoi has the least character flaws and the most plot armor out of any character in this show. Moving on, there is Black Rabbit, the character whose shirt is most likely to come off. That is all I have to say. Asuka Kudō girl from post-World War 2 Japan (all of them are from Japan) who can command anything organic or inorganic to do anything (the show somehow limits this power) and is really polite. There is Yō Kasukabe, the Hawkeye of the group from future Japan with a magic wooden amulet that allows her to take the powers of animals and creatures she has befriended.  

What I really don’t like about this show is that the characters have no connection. The explanation of superpowers or “gifts” as they are called is that they are just there. Some people are born God some people are born normal. Not much is stated to how the rest of the world perceives this. The protagonists come from different universes and not just in terms of origin. I just don’t see much interaction between the three protagonists or very much exploration into their backstories leaving them kind of half baked. 

Enjoyment (6/10)  

I can’t say I hated Isekai kara Kuru Sou Desu yo?. There were loveable moments and some great scenes. Its art and sound were very good. That being said, it could have done a lot to be a better anime in my eyes. Would I recommend it? Not necessarily and definitely not on the pretense that you enjoyed No Game No Life.

Seeing as there is already a review that expresses my opinions about this anime , i ll try to keep it short  in order to offer something to the potential viewers .If you want something short that doesn't contain any spoilers read on .

The story is good and it has the potential to be great-the presumes/the world that was conceived for the story to take place is enchanting ,the art is good and some moments great, the sound is decent and is even noticeable good when you begin watching (and that sayssomething since in most series you never pay much attention to the sound )the characters are likeable and fun to behold-despite or because they are powerful : it is rare to see powerful characters that actually flaunt the fact that they are Over-Powered around and still like them.\n
The pace is great- i wouldn't have it otherwise .But when you reach the end of it you are certain that the whole season is merely the first quarter of a much larger saga of at least 30 or so episodes.\n\n
To sum it up ,this is a great anime that is worth watching ,but the fact that it is clearly only the first part of a story reduces it to being simply good :it  cant be said for sure if in next seasons that could come it will still remain such an enjoyment yet if it does it will certainly make this series one of the most enjoying to be seen .\n

Hey folks, this will be a review for Mondaiji-tachi. I should say now that I love shows like this. This is my second time watching Mondaiji and I love it just as much as the first time I seen it. Anime seems to have world building down to a science. I could only hope to receive a letter and be taken to such a place, even if I don't have any superpowers.
The story of Mondaiji revolves around 3 humans from different timelines who have been summoned to this alternate world. This world is inhabited by a variety of people and beings, including but not limitedto gods, demons, vampires, ghosts, catgirls....etc. These people form communities and try to win games to expand their communities in a variety of ways. Our three main characters are summoned by one of the weakest communities and must help them get back on their feet. This is super interesting to me and I loved this world immediately.


As the anime progresses we seem to pull away from the game aspect. Though its still in the mix of the action, it feels as though it was more of an afterthought. Early in the show we are show some of how the world works, and some of the powers our three main characters have and how they stack up to these supernatural beings that inhabit this world, which they call the "Garden". The later half of the show is where we see our first big confrontation and where our characters must grow to overcome the challenges they are faced.


The art and sound were well done. Art wasn't anything to write home about. The soundtrack was pleasant and fit the mood of the anime very nicely.


Our characters are not very deep or thought provoking. We have our male lead(Sakamaki, Izayo) who is very strong, very much an op character. For those of you who dislike that Idea for some reason, you will probably have trouble enjoying the show. He manages to plow through gods, demon lords and anything that stands in his way without much effort. He also is intelligent and can come up with schemes. Our two female leads are Kasukabe, You and Kudou, Asuka. Kasukabe's power is to talk with animals as well as use their abilities. She can have the strength of an elephant, walk on air like a gryphon as well as has animal senses like keen hearing and smell. Asuka has the power to command things to do what she wished. Her power is rather abstract though as she can command items to give her their powers. 


Our side characters like the lunar rabbit, the gate keeper and the children from the community all play a small part. Most of the time they are their to explain something and to be of comedic value. As mentioned earlier the characters are not very deep and feel very forgettable. 


Even though our characters are shallow the enjoyment of the show isn't hampered. Exploring this world and watching as our main characters progress keeps your attention. Some things do take you out of the world for a short time. The first couple of episodes Izayo wins a rather lucky prize that's too good to be overlooked. Similarly our characters all are very arrogant and constantly start fights and games which could hold serious ramifications for the community as if they are nothing. They didn't handle their world as nicely as no game no life, however this anime is nothing to ignore. It has its faults but this genre of anime isn't very common and it was handled good enough to be worth the time spent watching its 10 episodes. I really wish there would be a second season but it doesn't seem as though one will come out.


TLDR; Give this a watch, its funny, interesting and semi unique. Has some flaws though and if you don't like op main characters I wouldn't bother.

Mondaiji-tachi ga Isekai kara Kuru Sou Desu yo? is a fun filled anime with vivid imagination, amazing artwork and adult humor for a teen show. I wake up every Friday with a smile on my face waiting for it to upload on my anime site. Honestly I am sad that it is only signed for 10 episodes. I wish it can go farther especially since they have so much potential. They have introduced many characters, different levels of cities that the main characters can advance etc. Maybe it's a sign for a second season (hoping and praying but unlikely). 
story(10)- It is original and entertaining.3 kids with unique powers and join a community less fortunate than most and build it from the ground up by playing games, and they can bet something  extreme such as their lives to something simple such as commanding someone for a day. 


Art(10)- That art is amazing. It is new so it better have amazing art. I have seen a new anime with crappy art style before and it just killed the whole thing for me. 


sound(10)- I am the type that doesn't care too much on sound. As long as it is aligned perfectly with the anime I am good to watch. So whatever site you see it on or if you download it (what i do) sound is completely up to you on this judgment. 


Characters(8)- I graded this the lowest because they have potential to expand. The characters are fine but they don't really go to much into depth with them. I would like to have more episodes to find out more. One day you see these people then boom onto another person. I need character depth to fully understand some of these characters and appreciate them for who they are.


Enjoyment(10)- As I said previously for me to wake up on Fridays with a smile on my face tells you something. I am watching older anime because current ones are slow or not amusing to the eye. (sorry I am a dude I like certain anime) The story line is the hook and this anime caught me. 


Overall I hope you all can trust my judgment and see for yourself how I thoroughly enjoy this anime.

Next in my review will be sound — in my opinion, the worst part of this anime. Of course, opening and ending can't be called terrible, moreover, they're suited to the mood of this show, but something like this I personally heard in "Kill me Baby" and "Ebiten", for example. 6/10.
Story, enjoyment and art are united inone intention: when in the final episodes story becomes totally eclectic with the elements of one German legend and some historical facts from the Middle-Ages European history, art becomes similar to the style of the 80's and due to that enjoyment becomes really impressive.\n
Overall — 7/10. I definitely won't rewatch this, but I didn't regret the time spent on "Mondaiji-tachi ga Isekai kara Kuru Sou Desu yo?".

-just 10 episodes. I WANT MORE!!\n

Other things:\n

well, let's just say the story is nice.\n\n
